title: PHPlchown()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPlchown()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Change the user ownership of a symbolic link:
<?php
$target = "downloads.php";
$link = "downloads";
symlink($target, $link);
lchown($link, 8)
?>
Definition and Usage
The lchown() function changes the user ownership of a symbolic link.
Note:
This is not an HTML link, but a link in the filesystem.
Note:
This function does not work on Windows platforms.
Syntax
lchown(
file
,
group
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the path to the symlink
group
Required. Specifies the new user by name or number
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success, FALSE on failure
PHP Version:
5.1.3+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPlchown()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPlchown()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPlchown()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
